content:
```json
{
  "relations": [
    {
      "from": "A82",
      "to": "A81",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "If Kotlin is preferable to Scala, it supports the idea that Scala's decline is sad, as it implies a better alternative exists.",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A85",
      "to": "A84",
      "type": "attacks",
      "explanation": "A85 suggests a way to achieve low-level understanding 'without headaches', implying C's approach might involve headaches, thus attacking C's pure low-level understanding as a sole benefit.",
      "strength": 0.6
    },
    {
      "from": "A91",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Fast compilation is a positive attribute for a backend option, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A92",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Good frameworks are a positive attribute for a backend option, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A93",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Superior concurrency handling is a strong advantage for a backend option, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.8
    },
    {
      "from": "A94",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Ease of deployment (running or containerizing) is a practical advantage for a backend option, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A95",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Being easy and fast to learn is a benefit that supports Golang as a good, potentially best, backend option.",
      "strength": 0.6
    },
    {
      "from": "A96",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Valuable explicit error handling is a positive feature for a backend language, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.6
    },
    {
      "from": "A97",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Easier maintenance due to plain design is a strong advantage for a backend option, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A98",
      "to": "A90",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "Easy to read and build code without fluff is a positive attribute for a backend option, supporting the claim that Golang is the best.",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A97",
      "to": "A98",
      "type": "supports",
      "explanation": "The plain design (A97) contributes to code being easy to read and build without fluff (A98).",
      "strength": 0.7
    },
    {
      "from": "A100",
      "to": "A99",
      "type": "attacks",
      "explanation": "A100 states a preference for plain working code over complex code, which directly attacks the idea that excessive abstractions (complexity) are acceptable.",
      "strength": 0.8
    },
    {
      "from": "A98",
      "to": "A99",
      "type": "attacks",
      "explanation": "A98 praises Golang code for being 'without fluff', which implicitly attacks 'excessive abstractions' mentioned in A99.",
      "strength": 0.6
    },
    {
      "from": "A97",
      "to": "A99",
      "type": "attacks",
      "explanation": "A97 praises Golang's 'plain design' for easier maintenance, which implicitly attacks 'excessive abstractions' mentioned in A99 as they complicate understanding.",
      "strength": 0.6
    }
  ]
}
```
